attachmentHtml:
PC Number: 2012-0009

Date: 2012-01-30

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 3(5) of the Canadian Dairy Commission Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of John Core, former Chief Executive Officer, Canadian Dairy Commission, as set out in the schedule hereto, which per diem is within the range ($850 - $995), for the period commencing August 1, 2011 and terminating October 6, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 43(1) of the Broadcasting Act, hereby fixes the salary of Hubert Lacroix, President, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 7 ($358,400 - $421,600), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(1) of the Canada Council Act, hereby fixes the salary of Robert Sirman, Director, Canada Council for the Arts, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($207,400 - $244,000), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby fixes the salary of Mark O'Neill, Director, Canadian Museum of Civilization, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($207,400 - $244,000), effective June 23, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby fixes the salary of Victor Rabinovitch, former Director, Canadian Museum of Civilization, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($207,400 - $244,000), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the salary of Stuart A. Murray, Director, Canadian Museum for Human Rights, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($172,900 - $203,400), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 12(1) of the Canadian Film Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Carolle Brabant, Executive Director, Telefilm Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($207,400 - $244,000), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the salary of Margaret Louise Beckel, Director, Canadian Museum of Nature, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($172,900 - $203,400), effective June 6, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the salary of Michel Houle, former Acting Director, Canadian Museum of Nature, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($172,900 - $203,400), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(3) of the National Arts Centre Act, hereby fixes the salary of Peter Herrndorf, President, National Arts Centre Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($185,800 - $218,500), effective September 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the salary of Marc Mayer, Director, National Gallery of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($172,900 - $203,400), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the salary of Denise Amyot, Director, National Museum of Science and Technology, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($172,900 - $203,400), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 11 of the Canadian Race Relations Foundation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Ayman Al-Yassini, Executive Director, Canadian Race Relations Foundation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 1 ($120,200 - $141,400), for the period commencing April 1, 2011 and terminating September 17, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(3)(c) of the Bank of Canada Act, hereby fixes the salary of Mark Carney, Governor, Bank of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary within the range ($425,300 - $500,300), effective January 1, 2011 and within the range ($431,800 - $507,900), effective January 1, 2012.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(3)(c) of the Bank of Canada Act, hereby fixes the salary of Tiff Macklem, Deputy Governor, Bank of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($297,800 - $350,300), effective January 1, 2011 and within the range ($302,300 - $355,600), effective January 1, 2012

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 16(1) of the Royal Canadian Mint Act, hereby fixes the salary of Ian E. Bennett, Master of the Mint, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($286,300 - $336,800), effective January 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 6 of the Freshwater Fish Marketing Act, hereby fixes the salary of John Wood, President, Freshwater Fish Marketing Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($150,800 - $177,300), effective May 1, 2011.

 

   

His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 9 of the International Development Research Centre Act, hereby fixes the salary of David Malone, President, International Development Research Centre, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($217,300 - $255,600), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 7(1) of the National Capital Act, hereby fixes the salary of Marie Lemay, Chief Executive Officer, National Capital Commission, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($216,400 - $254,500), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 7(2) of the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Karen Kinsley, President, Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 7 ($358,400 - $421,600), effective January 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 13(2) of the Business Development Bank of Canada Act, hereby fixes the salary of Jean-René Halde, President, Business Development Bank of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 6 ($298,700 - $351,400), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 14(4) of the Standards Council of Canada Act, hereby fixes the salary of John Walter, Executive Director, Standards Council of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($172,900 - $203,400), effective April 1, 2011.

 

 

 

 His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 15 of the Canadian Tourism Act, hereby fixes the salary of Michele Mary Anne McKenzie, President, Canadian Tourism Commission, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($207,400 - $244,000), effective January 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 3.1(2) of the Canadian Commercial Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Marc Whittingham, President, Canadian Commercial Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($207,400 - $244,000), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 9(2) of the Export Development Act, hereby fixes the salary of Stephen Poloz, President, Export Development Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 6 ($298,700 - $351,400), effective January 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 9(2) of the Export Development Act, hereby fixes the salary of Eric Siegel, former President, Export Development Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 6 ($293,500 - $345,300), effective December 31, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of Hugh MacDiarmid, former President and Chief Executive Officer, Atomic Energy of Canada Limited at the rate set out in the schedule hereto, which rate is within the salary range ($343,700 - $404,300), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   

 

 

His Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of Mark B. Laroche, President and Chief Executive Officer, Canada Lands Company Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($216,400 - $254,500), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of James Paul, President and Chief Executive Officer, Defence Construction (1951) Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($172,900 - $203,400), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of William Bruce Bryck, President and Chief Executive Officer, Parc Downsview Park Inc., as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 2 ($144,200 - $169,600), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 8(2) of the Canada Post Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Deepak Chopra, President, Canada Post Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 8 ($430,000 - $505,800), effective February 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 8(2) of the Canada Post Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Moya Greene, former President, Canada Post Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 8 ($422,500 - $497,100), effective July 14, 2010.

 

 

 

 His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 21 (2) of the Canadian Air Transport Security Authority Act, hereby fixes the salary of Kevin McGarr, former Chief Executive Officer, Canadian Air Transport Security Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($207,400 - $244,000), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of Micheline Dubé, Chief Executive Officer, Federal Bridge Corporation Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($172,900 - $203,400), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of Wayne M. Follett, former President and Chief Executive Officer, Marine Atlantic Inc., as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($172,900 - $203,400), effective April 1, 2011.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108 (1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary and other employment conditions of Robert Fernand Lemire, Chief Executive Officer, Great Lakes Pilotage Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 2 ($144,200 - $169,600), effective January 1, 20  

 

 Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 3(5) de la Loi sur la Commission canadienne du lait, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe la rémunération de John Core, ancien Premier dirigeant, Commission canadienne du lait, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel taux journalier se situe dans l'échelle salariale (850 $ - 995 $), pour la période commençant le 1er août 2011 et se terminant le 6 octobre 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 43(1) de la Loi sur la radiodiffusion, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Hubert Lacroix, Président-directeur général, Société Radio-Canada, conformément à l’annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 7 (358 400 $ - 421 600 $), à compter du 1er avril 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 6(1) de la Loi sur le Conseil des Arts du Canada, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Robert Sirman, Directeur, Conseil des Arts du Canada, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle CEO 4 (207 400 $ - 244 000 $), à compter du 1er avril 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 23(5) de la Loi sur les musées, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Mark O'Neill, Directeur, Musée canadien des civilisations, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 4 (207 400 $ - 244 000 $), à compter du 23 juin 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 23(5) de la Loi sur les musées, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Victor Rabinovitch, ancien Directeur, Musée canadien des civilisations, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 4 (207 400 $ - 244 000 $), à compter du 1er avril 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 23(5) de la Loi sur les musées, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil approuve le traitement de Stuart A. Murray, Directeur, Musée canadien des droits de la personne, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 3 (172 900 $ - 203 400 $), à compter du 1er avril 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 12(1) de la Loi sur la Société de développement de l'industrie cinématographique, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Carolle Brabant, Directeur général, Société Téléfilm Canada, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 4 (207 400 $ - 244 000 $), à compter du 1er avril, 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 23(5) de la Loi sur les musées, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Margaret Louise Beckel, Directeur, Musée canadien de la nature, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 3 (172 900 $ - 203 400 $), à compter du 6 juin 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 23(5) de la Loi sur les musées, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Michel Houle, ancien Directeur intérimaire, Musée canadien de la nature, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 3 (172 900 $ - 203 400 $), à compter du 1er avril 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 6(3) de la Loi sur le Centre national des arts, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Peter Herrndorf, Président, Corporation du Centre national des arts, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale (185 800 $ - 218 500 $), à compter du 1er septembre 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 23(5) de la Loi sur les musées, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Marc Mayer, Directeur, Musée des beaux-arts du Canada, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 3 (172 900 $ - 203 400 $), à compter du 1er avril 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 23(5) de la Loi sur les musées, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil approuve le traitement de Denise Amyot, Directeur, Musée national des sciences et de la technologie, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 3 (172 900 $ - 203 400 $), à compter du 1er avril 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu de l'article 11 de la Loi sur la Fondation canadienne des relations raciales, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Ayman Al-Yassini, Directeur général, Fondation canadienne des relations raciales, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 1 (120 200 $ - 141 400 $), pour la période commençant le 1er avril 2011 et se terminant le 17 septembre 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu de l'article 6(3)(c) de la Loi sur la Banque du Canada, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Mark Carney, Gouverneur, Banque du Canada, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement dans l'échelle (425 300 $ - 500 300 $), à compter du 1er janvier 2011 et dans l'échelle (431 800 $ - 507 900 $), à compter du 1er janvier 2012.

Bennett, Président de la Monnaie, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale (286 300 $ - 336 800 $), à compter du 1er janvier 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu de l'article 6 de la Loi sur la Commercialisation du poisson d'eau douce, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de John Wood, Président, Office de commercialisation du poisson d'eau douce, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale (150 800 $ - 177 300 $), à compter du 1er mai 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu de l'article 9 de la Loi sur le Centre de recherches pour le développement international, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de David Malone, Président, Centre de recherches pour le développement international, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle (217 300 $ - 255 600 $), à compter du 1er avril 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 7(1) de la Loi sur la capitale nationale, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Marie Lemay, Premier dirigeant, Commission de la capitale nationale, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale (216 400 $ - 254 500 $), à compter du 1er avril 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 7(2) de la Loi sur la Société canadienne d'hypothèques et de logement, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Karen Kinsley, Président, Société canadienne d'hypothèques et de logement, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 7 (358 400 $ - 421 600 $), à compter du 1er janvier 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 13(2) de la Loi sur la Banque de développement du Canada,Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Jean-René Halde, Président, Banque de développement du Canada, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 6 (298 700 $ - 351 400 $), à compter du 1er avril 2011.

 

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 14(4) de la Loi sur Conseil canadien des normes, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de John Walter, Directeur général, Conseil canadien des normes, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, dont le traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 3 (172 900 $ - 203 400 $), à compter du 1er avril 2011.

   Sur recommandation du premier ministre et en vertu du paragraphe 9(2) de la Loi sur l'expansion des exportations, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil fixe le traitement de Stephen Poloz, Président, Exportation et Développement Canada, conformément à l'annexe ci-jointe, lequel traitement se situe dans l'échelle salariale CEO 6 (298 700 $ - 351 400 $), à compter du 1er janvier 2011.

attachmentText:
PC Number: 2012-0009Date: 2012-01-30


	 	 His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 3(5) of the Canadian Dairy Commission Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of John Core, former Chief Executive Officer, Canadian Dairy Commission, as set out in the schedule hereto, which per diem is within the range ($850 - $995), for the period commencing August 1, 2011 and terminating October 6, 2011.
